title: What is the solution set of the equation [√ (2x+6)] + 4 = x + 3? - Quora

response.answer_text: [math]\sqrt{(2x+6)}+4=x+3[/math] =>[math]\sqrt{(2x+6)}=x-1[/math] =>[math](2x+6)=(x-1)^2[/math] =>[math]x^2-2x+1=2x+6[/math] =[math]>x^2–4x-5=0[/math] =>[math]x^2–4x+4-9=0[/math] =>[math](x-2)^2-3^2=0[/math] =>[math](x-2+3)(x-2-3)=0[/math] =>[math](x+1)(x-5)=0[/math] =>[math]x+1=0[/math] or [math]x[/math]-5[math]=0[/math] =>x=-1 or x=5 Verification: For x=-1 [math]\sqrt{(2x+6)}+4[/math] =[math]\sqrt{(-2+6)}+4[/math] =[math]\sqrt{4}+4[/math] =2+4 or -2+4 =6 or -2 [math]x+3[/math] =-1+3 =-2 Equation satisfied by negative square root. For x=5 [math]\sqrt{(2x+6)}+4[/math] =[math]\sqrt{(10+6)}+4[/math] =[math]\sqrt{(16)}+4[/math] =4+4 or -4+4 =8 or 0 [math]x+3[/math] =5+3 =8 Equation satisfied by positive square root. p.s.: square root can be positive or negative. If we are not accepting negative square root then we can drop solution -1.
[√(2x+6)]+4=x+3 or. [√(2x+6)]=x-1 Squaring both sides. 2x+6=x^2-2x+1 or. x^2-4x-5=0 or. x^2-5x+x-5=0 or. x(x-5)+1(x-5)=0 or. (x-5).(x+1)=0 x= 5. or. -1. Thus , the solution set is {5,-1}. Answer.
